meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with propriety or decorum.
meanings.sent1: The prigs at the party kept criticizing everyone's manners.
meanings.sent2: She always acts like a prigs, constantly reminding us of etiquette rules.
meanings.sent3: The prigs in the office even complained about the font on the memos.
meanings.sent4: The prigs of the neighborhood looked down on anyone who didn't mow their lawn weekly.
meanings.sent5: The prigs in the book club made sure everyone followed the reading schedule to the minute.

meanings.definition: To behave or speak in a self-righteous or moralistic manner.
meanings.sent1: He prigs about his healthy lifestyle choices all the time.
meanings.sent2: Don't prigs about how early you wake up every morning.
meanings.sent3: She prigs about recycling but forgets to turn off the lights.
meanings.sent4: The politician prigs about honesty while hiding his own secrets.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prigs about punctuality but is always late to class.
